newsitem.title: UK: Proteus extends gain on "mad cow" test news.
newsitem.headline: Proteus extends gain on "mad cow" test news.

text.p: Shares in Proteus International Plc rose in pre-market trading on Friday, extending yesterday's surge after the company's statement late in the session on certification for its "mad cow" disease test.
The stock was up 12-1/2p at 70 by 0815 GMT in volume of 151,000 shares after on Thursday rising 17p.
Proteus said the test had been independently validated for use in Ireland as a test to screen beef carcasses for the disease.

The test was origninally developed by Proteus in collaboration with University College Dublin and was further developed by Ireland's Enfer Scientific, granted a worldwide licence to cover post-mortem testing in return for royalty payments.
